an4.20:1.1: “Mendicants, a meal assigner who has four qualities is cast down to hell.
an4.20:1.3: They make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.
an4.20:1.4: A meal assigner who has these four qualities is cast down to hell.
an4.20:2.1: A meal designator who has four qualities is raised up to heaven.
an4.20:2.3: They make decisions unprejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.
an4.20:2.4: A meal assigner who has these four qualities is raised up to heaven.
an4.20:3.1: All those people with unbridled sensuality,
an4.20:3.2: unprincipled, with no respect for principle,
an4.20:3.3: led astray <j>by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, or cowardice,
an4.20:3.4: are called ‘an assembly of the dregs’:
an4.20:4.1: that’s what was said by the ascetic who knows.
an4.20:4.2: And so those praiseworthy true persons,
an4.20:4.3: standing on principle, doing nothing wrong,
an4.20:4.4: not led astray <j>by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, or cowardice,
an4.20:4.5: are called ‘an assembly of the cream’:
an4.20:4.6: that’s what was said by the ascetic who knows.”
